titles.title: The Head That Once Was Crowned with Thorns

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: The head that once was crowned with thorns is crowned with glory now; a royal diadem adorns the mighty Victor's brow.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: The highest place that heav'n affords is His, is His by right, the King of kings and Lord of lords, and heav'n's eternal Light.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: The joy of all who dwell above, the joy of all below, to whom He manifests His love, and grants His name to know.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: To them the cross with all its shame, with all its grace, is giv'n, their name, an everlasting name, their joy, the joy of heav'n.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: They suffer with their Lord below, they reign with Him above, their profit and their joy to know the myst'ry of His love.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: The cross He bore is life and health, though shame and death to Him: His people's Hope, His people's Wealth, their everlasting Theme!
